definitions: land or area along the edge of a river
examples: We walked along the riverside watching boats pass by
The riverside restaurant offers beautiful views during sunset

definitions: short metal pin for joining metal plates by hammering
examples: The bridge construction requires thousands of rivets for strength
Workers hammered each rivet carefully into the steel beams

definitions: very small stream or brook of flowing water
examples: A tiny rivulet trickled down the mountainside after rain
Children played beside the rivulet running through the meadow

definitions: common household pest insect with flat brown body
small freshwater fish found in European rivers and lakes
examples: The apartment had a roach problem requiring professional treatment
We found roaches hiding behind the kitchen cabinets yesterday
The angler caught several roach using bread as bait
Roach swim in schools near the riverbank vegetation areas

definitions: foundation structure beneath a road or railway track
examples: Engineers inspected the roadbed before laying new asphalt pavement
Heavy rains damaged the roadbed causing dangerous driving conditions

definitions: barrier set up to stop traffic for inspection
obstacle that prevents progress or achievement of goals
examples: Police set up roadblocks to catch the escaped prisoners
The roadblock caused major traffic delays during rush hour
Budget constraints became a roadblock to completing the project
Language barriers created roadblocks in international business negotiations

definitions: restaurant or inn located along a highway outside city
examples: The old roadhouse served hearty meals to traveling truckers
We stopped at a roadhouse for dinner during our trip

definitions: animal killed by vehicle traffic on roads or highways
examples: Drivers should watch for roadkill when traveling at night
Highway crews remove roadkill to prevent accidents and disease

definitions: fast-running ground bird found in southwestern deserts with long tail
examples: The roadrunner darted across the desert chasing a lizard
Roadrunners can run up to twenty miles per hour

definitions: area immediately beside or along the edge of road
examples: Wildflowers bloomed along the roadside during spring months
The family stopped at a roadside fruit stand for peaches

definitions: open two-seat car designed for sport driving without fixed roof
examples: He drove his vintage roadster with the top down today
The sleek roadster attracted attention at the car show

definitions: part of road used by vehicles for travel
examples: Construction crews repaired cracks in the roadway before winter
The roadway was clear after snowplows finished their work

definitions: horse with coat color mixing white with another base color
examples: The beautiful roan mare grazed peacefully in the pasture
She preferred riding the gentle roan over other horses

definitions: loud deep prolonged sound like that made by lion
examples: The lion's roar echoed across the African savanna at dawn
We heard the roar of engines at the motorcycle rally

definitions: loud continuous sound of something powerful or intense in motion
examples: The roaring of the waterfall could be heard from miles
A roaring fire warmed the cabin during the winter storm

definitions: large piece of meat cooked in oven or over fire
examples: Sunday dinner featured a delicious beef roast with vegetables
The roast needs to cook for three hours at low temperature

definitions: method of cooking food using dry heat in oven
examples: Roasting vegetables brings out their natural sweet flavors perfectly
The roasting process takes longer but produces tender meat

definitions: person who steals from others using force or threats
examples: The bank robber was caught by police within hours
Store owners installed cameras to deter potential robbers completely

definitions: crime of stealing from someone using force or threats
examples: The convenience store robbery happened during the night shift
Police investigated the jewelry store robbery for several weeks

definitions: long loose garment worn for comfort or ceremonial purposes
examples: She wrapped herself in a warm robe after bathing
The judge entered the courtroom wearing a black robe

definitions: common songbird with red breast found in gardens and parks
examples: The first robin appeared as a sign of spring
Robins built their nest in our backyard apple tree

definitions: early rock music style blending country with rhythm and blues from 1950s
examples: The band played classic rockabilly tunes at the vintage festival
Rockabilly fashion includes leather jackets and pompadour hairstyles today

definitions: chair mounted on curved supports allowing rocking motion
person who performs or enjoys rock music professionally or enthusiastically
examples: Grandmother sat in her favorite rocker knitting warm scarves
The antique rocker creaked gently on the front porch
The veteran rocker performed his greatest hits at the concert
Young rockers formed bands in their garage after school

definitions: science and technology of designing building and launching rockets into space
examples: Students studied rocketry principles in their advanced physics class
Modern rocketry enables satellites to orbit Earth monitoring weather

definitions: elaborate decorative art and architecture style from 18th century France featuring curves
examples: The palace featured rococo decoration with gold leaf everywhere
Rococo furniture includes intricate carvings and pastel colors throughout

definitions: small mammal with continuously growing front teeth for gnawing including mice rats
examples: The barn cat helped control the rodent population naturally
Rodents can damage electrical wires by chewing through insulation

definitions: public competition featuring cowboy skills like bronco riding and roping cattle
examples: The annual rodeo attracts thousands of spectators every summer
Cowboys practiced for months before the championship rodeo event

definitions: mass of eggs contained in female fish used as food
examples: The chef prepared salmon roe as a delicate appetizer
Fish roe contains high levels of beneficial omega-3 fatty acids

definitions: dishonest or unprincipled person who acts independently
wild animal living apart from its normal group especially dangerous elephant
examples: The charming rogue tricked tourists with elaborate confidence schemes
Police warned citizens about a rogue trader in the area
Rangers tracked the rogue elephant that damaged village crops
A rogue lion separated from its pride becomes more dangerous

definitions: activity of acting out roles or characters in games or training scenarios
examples: Students practiced conflict resolution through workplace roleplaying exercises
Roleplaying games let players create fantasy characters and adventures

definitions: reduction of prices to previous lower level
reversal of system or policy changes to earlier state
examples: The store announced a rollback on electronics prices today
Customers appreciated the price rollback on everyday items significantly
The software rollback fixed problems caused by recent updates
Management decided on policy rollback after employee complaints increased

definitions: cylindrical object that rotates for smoothing painting or moving
long swelling wave that moves steadily without breaking
examples: Paint rollers make covering large wall areas much faster
The dough roller helped create perfectly thin pizza crusts
Surfers waited patiently for the perfect roller to ride
Large rollers crashed against the rocky coastline during storms

definitions: accident where vehicle tips completely over during crash
transfer of funds from one retirement account to another
examples: The SUV rollover accident closed the highway for hours
Safety features help prevent rollover accidents in modern vehicles
She completed a rollover from her old employer's retirement plan
Tax-free rollovers must follow specific IRS guidelines and deadlines

definitions: variety of lettuce with long crisp leaves used in salads
examples: Caesar salad traditionally uses fresh romaine lettuce leaves exclusively
The grocery store stocked organic romaine in the produce section

definitions: artistic and intellectual movement emphasizing emotion imagination and nature from late 18th century
examples: Romanticism influenced poetry painting and music throughout Europe significantly
Students studied romanticism's impact on literature and social thought

definitions: lively playful activity or game especially by children or animals
examples: Children enjoyed a romp in the park after school
The puppies had a joyful romp in the backyard

definitions: materials used to construct or cover roof of building
examples: The contractor recommended metal roofing for better weather protection
New roofing improved the home's appearance and energy efficiency

definitions: flat or sloped top surface of building accessible for use
examples: The restaurant's rooftop terrace offers stunning city views nightly
Solar panels covered the rooftop generating clean electricity daily

definitions: castle-shaped chess piece moving straight lines horizontally vertically
large black crow-like bird common in Europe nesting colonially
examples: She moved her rook to protect the king from checkmate
The rook controls entire rows and columns on the chessboard
Rooks gathered noisily in the tall trees near the church
Farmers consider rooks pests when they damage newly planted crops

definitions: person who shares living space like apartment or dormitory room
examples: My college roommate became a lifelong friend after graduation
Finding a compatible roommate makes apartment living more affordable

definitions: place where birds rest or sleep especially at night
examples: Chickens returned to their roost as darkness approached slowly
The old barn provided a perfect roost for owls

definitions: adult male chicken with distinctive comb and tail feathers
examples: The rooster crowed loudly at dawn every single morning
Their colorful rooster strutted proudly around the farmyard daily

definitions: process of plant developing roots or encouraging root growth
act of supporting or cheering enthusiastically for team or person
examples: Proper rooting techniques ensure healthy plant growth and development
The cutting showed signs of rooting after two weeks
Fans were rooting loudly for their home team to win
Everyone was rooting for the underdog in the championship

definitions: person skilled in using rope especially for catching cattle
examples: The experienced roper caught the calf on first attempt
Professional ropers compete in rodeo events for prize money
